sen.j: 今出川実富（いまでがわ さねとみ、生年不詳－正長元年7月8日 (旧暦)（1428年8月18日））は、室町時代の公卿。
sen.e: Sanetomi IMADEGAWA (it is not known when he was born - August 18, 1428) was a kugyo (top court official) who lived in the Muromachi period.
Sanetomi IMADEGAWA (date of birth unknown - August 18, 1428) was a kugyo (top court official) who lived during the Muromachi period.
Sanetomi IMADEGAWA (year of birth unknown - August 27, 1428) was a kugyo (court noble) who lived during the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: 用語統一グレゴリオ歴に変更

sen.j: 後小松天皇（100代）・称光天皇（101代）の二帝にわたり仕え、官位は正二位大納言まで昇る。
sen.e: He served two emperors of Emperor Gokomatsu (100th emperor) and Emperor Shoko (101st emperor), and advanced up to Dainagon (a major counselor) at the rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
He served two emperors, Emperor Gokomatsu (100th emperor) and Emperor Shoko (101st emperor), and advanced to Dainagon (major counselor) at the rank of Shonii (Senior 2nd Rank).
He served two emperors, Emperor Gokomatsu (the 100th) and Emperor Shoko (the 101st), and advanced to Dainagon (chief councilor of state) at the rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank).

sen.j: 父は左大臣今出川公行。
sen.e: His father was Sadaijin (Minister of the left), Kinyuki IMADEGAWA.

sen.j: 子息に左大臣今出川教季がいる。
sen.e: Norisue IMADEGAWA, Sadaijin, was his son.
Norisue IMADEGAWA, Sadaijin, was his son.
Norisue IMADEGAWA, Sadaijin, was his son.

sen.j: 応永9年（1402年）従三位となり、公卿に列する。
sen.e: In 1402, he was awarded the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), becoming a kugyo.
In 1402, he was awarded the rank of Jusanmi (Junior 3rd Rank), becoming a kugyo.
In 1402, he was awarded the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), becoming a kugyo.

sen.j: 以降累進して、参議・越中国・中納言をへて、応永20年（1413年）から応永28年（1421年）までにわたって大納言をつとめた。
sen.e: Continued being promoted after that, he assumed Dainagon from 1413 to 1421, after assuming Sangi (a councilor), a post in Ecchu Province and Chunagon (a middle counselor).
Continuing to be promoted after that, he assumed Dainagon from 1413 to 1421, after assuming Sangi (councilor), a post in Ecchu Province and Chunagon (middle counselor).
Continuing to be promoted after that, he assumed Dainagon from 1413 to 1421, after assuming Sangi (councilor), a post in Ecchu Province and Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 用語統一スペース削除vice－councilor →vice-councilor
